title: France denies allegations it pressured EU to buy French vaccines over German
author: William Adkins
description: The efforts to find a scapegoat for the slow rollout of jabs has firmly started in Europe.
cleaned_text: Clément Beaune strongly denied allegations that the EU passed on purchasing more German-made vaccines to make Paris happy. "These accusations are unacceptable and false," Beaune [tweeted](https://twitter.com/CBeaune/status/1346449727664099328?s=20). As many in Europe are looking for a [culprit](https://www.politico.eu/article/the-vaccination-blame-game-is-it-all-the-eus-fault/) behind the lack of ongoing vaccinations, Karl Lauterbach of Germany's Social Democrats (SPD) has taken aim at France, [stating that](https://twitter.com/pthibaut/status/1346372909577744384?s=20) "the French insisted for the number of [BioNTech/Pfizer] doses to not be too large compared to [the number of Sanofi doses] although this vaccine was far from ready." Lauterbach's accusations echo a Der Spiegel report [from December](https://www.spiegel.de/politik/deutschland/deutschland-und-die-eu-haben-zu-wemig-a-00000000-0002-0001-0000-000174544038), stating that the EU rejected the opportunity of buying more doses of the vaccine made by the American firm Pfizer and BioNTech, a German company — even as early studies suggested it was among the most promising candidates. "These is no question that Paris hugely protected Sanofi," the report says, referring to the French pharmaceutical giant that is [scheduled to release](https://uk.reuters.com/article/health-coronavirus-vaccines-sanofi/sanofi-and-gsk-delay-covid-19-vaccine-marking-setback-for-global-fight-idUKKBN28L0II) a vaccine at the tail-end of 2021. "We made collective choices. German laboratories are no less well treated; we order 300 million doses from BioNTech, more than 400 from CureVac, more than [what we are ordering from] Sanofi," Beaune added.
